description: Mapping this area is difficult. There are a lot of attacks going on from both Russian and Ukrainian forces (I have decided not to map many of the Ukrainian attacks out of an abundance of caution). For this reason
column4: I have made much of the area gray area
column5: because I am not sure who
column8: I am not sure where exactly some of the Russian attacks are coming from. For example
column10: are the Russians moving along the river
column11: or more inland? Does Ukraine control the river area? I am not sure. I have read that Russia controls the area along the river
column12: which is how I have mapped it. But simultaneously
column13: I have seen a lot of evidence that Ukraine controls the southern part of Bilohorivka
column14: which I have left as a gray area on the map. There have been attacks towards Serebryanka
column15: which obviously have to pass through this gray area as well
column16: and also attacks towards Verkhnokamyanske. On top of all of this
column17: Ukraine claims there are two towns in Luhanske that Russia has failed to capture. We know Bilohorivka is one
column18: but which is the other? There are two options: Zolotarivka and Verkhnokamyanka. I have seen evidence of Ukrainian forces in Zolotarivka
column19: so I have decided to map this town as contested. It could be the other that is contested. Or maybe Ukraine is lying and neither are contested.

name: and they are heavily shelling the area with Grad MLRS and s300 anti-aircraft missiles (A). Russians tried to attack Hryhorivka
description: but they were repelled (5). There is ongoing fighting in Verkhnokamyanske (6).

name: and they are heavily shelling the area with Grad MLRS and s300 anti-aircraft missiles (A). Russians tried to attack Hryhorivka
description: but they were repelled (5). There is ongoing fighting in Verkhnokamyanske (6).
There are rumors that Russia captured Ivano-Darivka (7)
column4: but I have seen no evidence to support it. I believe fighting is ongoing. Similarly
column5: there are rumors that Russia has pushed through Spirne (8)
column6: but I have not seen contrary evidence that their attacks are being stifled.

description: There are rumors that Russia captured Ivano-Darivka (7)
column4: but I have seen no evidence to support it. I believe fighting is ongoing. Similarly
column5: there are rumors that Russia has pushed through Spirne (8)
column6: but I have not seen contrary evidence that their attacks are being stifled.

description: Ukrainian forces have abandoned Berestove after roughly 59 days of fighting (9)
column4: which seems to be about the maximum extent Ukraine has been able to hold each of these small towns. After a while every single structure is destroyed and you run out of things to defend
column5: at which point Ukraine decides to pull back to another town where the process starts anew. However
column6: Russia still has not been able to capture the town (10) due to liberal application of Ukrainian artillery.

description: There is ongoing fighting in the outskirts of Soledar (11).
There is heavy ongoing fighting around Pokrovske (12
column5: and some of the lesser Russian sources are claiming the town is captured
column6: although the better sources have not made any such claim. Similarly
column7: Russia is pushing very hard to attack Vesela Dolyna (14) and Vershyna (15). And the lesser Russian sources claim they have been captured
column8: while the better Russian sources have made no such claim. I have not seen evidence that Russia has even reached the towns yet and are still fighting in the outskirts. Russia very much wants to capture these three towns so they can begin attacking Bakhmut. Russia’s goal is to push Ukraine back to their Slovyansk/Kramatorsk/Kostyantynivka defensive line as fast as possible. Every day that passes
column9: Ukraine gets stronger and Russia gets weaker.

description: There is ongoing fighting around the Vuhlehirske power plant (16) and Novoluhanske (17) and while these positions are holding off for the moment
column4: you could see them collapse in the near future due to what is going on north of them.

description: Russia isn’t having much luck attacking Kamyanka

description: Yesterday I read that Ukraine had attacked out of Vuhledar towards Mykilske (20)
column4: but that the attack was destroyed. I could not find confirmation of this attack
column5: and I found it unlikely such an attack would be destroyed so I didn’t mention it. Now
column7: there is a report that Russia tried to attack Mykilske but were repelled (21). So
column8: perhaps Ukraine did move into Mykilske yesterday. I will leave it marked as contested for now.
